qas.question: Quranic verses concerning which phenomena are thought by Muslims to authenticate its contents?
What types of events are related in the Quran in support of its moral teachings?
Historical narratives from whose time period are unique to the Quran among holy books?
Quranic verses concerning which phenomena are thought by Muslims to unauthenticate its contents?
Quranic verses concerning which phenomena are thought by Jews to authenticate its contents?
What types of events aren't related in the Quran in support of its moral teachings?
What types of events are unrelated in the Quran in support of its moral teachings?
Historical narratives from whose time period aren't unique to the Quran among holy books?

context: The Quranic content is concerned with basic Islamic beliefs including the existence of God and the resurrection. Narratives of the early prophets, ethical and legal subjects, historical events of <a2_0><b7_0>Muhammad's<b7_0/><a2_0/> time, charity and prayer also appear in the Quran. The Quranic verses contain general exhortations regarding right and wrong and <a1_0><b5_0><b6_0>historical<b6_0/><b5_0/><a1_0/> events are related to outline general moral lessons. Verses pertaining to <a0_0><b3_0><b4_0>natural<b4_0/><b3_0/><a0_0/> phenomena have been interpreted by Muslims as an indication of the authenticity of the Quranic message.
